title: Claudio Ranieri facing dressing room crisis as Leicester fairytale heads towards disaster amid unrest
text:
Sport Claudio Ranieri facing dressing room crisis as Leicester fairytale heads towards disaster amid unrest Ranieri has the support of the club’s Thai owner and has challenged any unhappy players to speak to the chairman Share Ranieri's methods have failed to work this season (Photo: 2017 Getty Images)     
Claudio Ranieri is facing major dressing-room unrest as Leicester’s title defence heads towards disaster. 
Ranieri was named FIFA coach of the year for incredibly guiding the 5,000-1 shots to the Premier League title last season. 
But Mirror Sport understands there is mounting dissent in the Foxes’ dressing room among senior stars at Ranieri’s chopping and changing of tactics and personnel. 
Ranieri, 65, is now bookies favourite to be the next Premier League manager to lose his job and there is growing doubt he may not last the season. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Ranieri faces the press after 3-0 thrashing by Manchester United Share this video Watch Next 
A fourth successive top-flight loss to Manchester United has left the champions just two points off the bottom. 
They have yet to score a league goal in 2017 and they are in danger of becoming the first title-winning side to be relegated since Man City in 1938. 
After the United loss, fuming keeper Kasper Schmeichel urged everyone “from the top to the bottom of this club, to be counted.” 
Ranieri, previously dubbed ‘The Tinkerman’ when boss of Chelsea from 2000-2004, now faces a challenge to keep his squad united behind his tactics and philosophy. Ranieri does retain support from the club's hierarchy (Photo: REUTERS) 
Ranieri has the support of the club’s Thai owner Vichai Srivaddhanaprabha and has challenged any unhappy players to speak to the chairman. 
That appears a last resort the squad are unwilling to consider at present. 
But Ranieri has already publicly admitted Srivaddhanaprabha has repeatedly stressed to him the importance of staying up, ahead of the Champions League or FA Cup. 
And Leicester’s senior players are currently known to be worried and concerned their plight is heading them to an astonishing relegation.
